citation.article-title: Phylogeny of Photorhabdus and Xenorhabdus based on universally conserved protein-coding sequences and implications for the taxonomy of these two genera. Proposal of new taxa: X. vietnamensis sp. nov., P. luminescens subsp. caribbeanensis subsp. nov., P. luminescens subsp. hainanensis subsp. nov., P. temperata subsp. khanii subsp. nov., P. temperata subsp. tasmaniensis subsp. nov., and the reclassification of P. luminescens subsp. thracensis as P. temperata subsp. thracensis.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Xenorhabdus vietnamensis sp. nov.
Xenorhabdus vietnamensis [vi.et.nam.en′sis N.L. fem. adj. vietnamensis from Vietnam, the source of the nematode Steinernema sangi (Phan et al., 2001) from which the type strain was isolated].
Growth in LB broth is stopped by temperatures above 37 °C.

In contrast to the closely related species X. japonica, colonies are pink, hydrolyse aesculin, show a lecithinase activity, produce acid from trehalose and assimilate putrescine, but not d-alanine (Tailliez et al., 2006).
The GenBank accession number of the 16S rRNA gene sequence of the type strain is DQ205447.
